comments.author: wgianopoulos@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20040102 Firebird/0.7+
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20040102 Firebird/0.7+

Find in This Page does not work if the search string contains the '/' charcter.
 Strangely it does work if the '/' charcater is the last (or only) character in
the search string, but fails to find anything if the '/' character is anywhere
else in the string.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. go to
http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsquery.cgi?treeid=default&module=PhoenixTinderbox&branch=FIREBIRD_0_8_BRANCH&branchtype=match&dir=&file=&filetype=match&who=&whotype=match&sortby=Date&hours=2&date=explicit&mindate=12%2F31%2F2003&maxdate=1%2F1%2F2004&cvsroot=%2Fcvsroot
2. Click on Edit->Find in This Page 
3. Enter browser/app as the text to search for
4. Click on Find Next
Actual Results:  
Recieved pop-up saying "The text you entered was not found"

Expected Results:  
Should have found the text as it is present on the page
comments.creator: wgianopoulos@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20040102 Firebird/0.7+
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20040102 Firebird/0.7+

Find in This Page does not work if the search string contains the '/' charcter.
 Strangely it does work if the '/' charcater is the last (or only) character in
the search string, but fails to find anything if the '/' character is anywhere
else in the string.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. go to
http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsquery.cgi?treeid=default&module=PhoenixTinderbox&branch=FIREBIRD_0_8_BRANCH&branchtype=match&dir=&file=&filetype=match&who=&whotype=match&sortby=Date&hours=2&date=explicit&mindate=12%2F31%2F2003&maxdate=1%2F1%2F2004&cvsroot=%2Fcvsroot
2. Click on Edit->Find in This Page 
3. Enter browser/app as the text to search for
4. Click on Find Next
Actual Results:  
Recieved pop-up saying "The text you entered was not found"

Expected Results:  
Should have found the text as it is present on the page

I don't see "browser/app" on this page but "browser/ app" (with a space).
So it's normal that it is not found.
comments.text:
I don't see "browser/app" on this page but "browser/ app" (with a space).
So it's normal that it is not found.
comments.creator: mozbug@durys.net
comments.author: mozbug@durys.net
wgianopoulos@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
That has to do with the font.  The text on the page actually says browser/app. 
You can do a view source and then search for browser/app in the view source
window and that finds it.  Also it finds nothing if you search for "browser/
app", so that is NOT the problem.
comments.text:

You can do a view source and then search for browser/app in the view source

app", so that is NOT the problem.

Hmm.  OK I was incorrect.  The text onthe page does say "browser/ app" with a
space, but searching for that finds no matches either so there it is still broke.
